alert.note: Alert for Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:02PM EST until January 11 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following county, City of Manassas, City of Manassas Park and Prince William. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 202 PM EST, River gauges indicated that flooding is ongoing in many locations in the warned area, particularly urban areas. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dale City... Woodbridge... Quantico... Lake Ridge... Linton Hall... Montclair... Bull Run... Triangle... Dumfries... Haymarket... Manassas... Sudley... Cherry Hill... Manassas Park... Gainesville... New Baltimore... Independent Hill... Mason Neck... Nokesville... Occoquan... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
